reviewText: I didn't really find this movie too funny.  Yes there were supposedly hilarious predicaments between the two couples.  The reason I wanted to even see it was because Jane Lynch was in it and I find her to be funny.  Yes, Jane Lynch was good in her role, but I have to say, that I did not really find this movie funny.  I just found it to be stupid.  It was too ridiculous to be amusing to me.

I didn't really know what to expect when I began watching this movie.  I'm glad I watched it however...it's absolutely frigging hilarious.  Bryan Callen has some really good comic reactions, and Matt Servitto and Jane Lynch are drop-dead hysterical as the crazy couple.  If you like your comedies completely absurd and over-the-top, you'll probably like this.

OMG- I went to a screening of this in the director's hometown Baltimore. This is truly one of the funniest movies I have ever seen. Jane Lynch had me laughing so hard that I was embarrassed for being so loud, but I couldn't help it. Be warned, there is some pretty risqu humor in this movie but that's why it works. In between outrageously funny moments are interspersed scenes so insane that only a crazy man could think it up. Thats meant to be a compliment in that a movie that can make you hurt from laughter and squirm seconds later is a gem in this era of formulaic romantic comedies. This director clearly has issues and let me say- I'm glad he does!! Lastly, I'll say that in spite of the silliness, there is a warmth to the movie that has you leaving feeling satisfied...5 stars!!!

I came across this Dvd because another film had a similar title... I decided to get both.., Both were great value buys... I'd put this movie up against any relationship comedy out there on the market and probably come out the winner.., My expressions became "Whoa!" & "these people are crazy"... This movie is funny, a good value buy, A great ride, people will like this selection...

After completing pre-cana classes less than a year ago, you'd figure I'd find some comedy in a movie parody of the process. Instead my experience with this movie started out as a mild amusement for an unusual couple leading the sessions. This amusement quickly developed into an annoyance before evolving into full-blown disgust. Think of Meet the Parents with Robert De Niro having an interest in Ben Stiller's sexual fantasies before revealing his fetish for milking anything with nipples. Over the top comedy usually works better when there is an actual light at the end of the tunnel. It also helps when you care enough about the characters to actually see how things play out rather than wishing you didn't witness the freak show in the first place. This is a film that would seem most appreciated by a teenage audience who giggle at any sexual reference imaginable, while the rest of the crowd is left waiting for the punch line that never arrives.
So hilarious, just don't get it why people have given it such low ratings!

This is a stupid and annoying film. I stopped watching it halfway through.  It's a big waste of time.

I do know one thing:  When my husband and I went to Pre-cana conferences in the Catholic Church, they were performed by the Catholic Priest and not by any lay couple, and especially not by any uninformed, ignorant couple as in this dumb film.

As someone who is married, the ironies were not lost on me as they amplified the complications that come along with the big commitment of marriage. It was funny enough to keep me watching once. I gave it 3 stars because it's probably not something I would want to pay to watch again, but if you have prime to watch it free, and you are super bored give it a go. I had a good laugh post movie at the comments saying all the people around them were terrible people... that was kind of the point! That you shouldn't look to other people's opinions on your relationship. The only people you should consult on your relationship is yourself and your partner. If your aren't comfortable with taboo subjects just skip this movie. If taboo subjects don't bother you, I think you will be amused.
